conbody.p: This topic provides examples that demonstrate how to draw ellipses and arcs. The first draws the whole ellipse; the second, one section of the ellipse; and in the third, the other section of the ellipse is drawn (also illustrating construction lines and points). It also shows how to draw two pie slices making an ellipse.
The code assumes that the ellipse and arc examples all use a common pre-defined rectangle:
conbody.codeblock: ... TRect ellipseRect=Rect(); // for arcs and ellipse ellipseRect.Shrink(10,10); // set size so inside the border rectangle ...
conbody.p: The arc and pie slice examples use two construction points as arguments:
conbody.codeblock:
... TPoint screenCenterPoint=rect.Center(); // the center of the screen
// set up a pair of construction points for arc and pie slice drawing TPoint constructionPoint1(15,15); // outside the construction ellipse TPoint constructionPoint2(200,150); // inside the construction ellipse ...
conbody.p: The center point is drawn in the second arc example to clarify arc construction.

section.title: How to draw an ellipse
section.p: You can use DrawEllipse() to draw an ellipse.

section.title: How to draw an arc
section.p: An arc is drawn as a portion of an ellipse. As well as the ellipse rectangle, the call must specify the two points: the first defines one end of a line from the geometric center of the ellipse; the point of intersection between this line and the ellipse defines the start point of the arc. The second specified point acts in the same way for the end of the arc.
The example code here shows how an arc is drawn in an anti-clockwise direction using constructionPoint1 and constructionPoint2 as the start to the end points.
You can reverse the pair of construction point arguments to draw the other half of the ellipse. The construction points and screen center are also drawn, with dotted construction lines:

section.title: Drawing pie slices
section.p: The example code here shows how two pie slices are drawn. A pie slice is the area bounded by:
the straight line from the start point from the geometric center of the ellipse
the straight line from the end point from the geometric center of the ellipse
Solid and patterned brush styles are used to fill the portions of the elliptical disc.

li.p: Use SetBrushStyle() to set the brush style to solid.
Use SetBrushColour() to set the brush color to black.
Use DrawPie() to draw a pie slice.
Use SetBrushStyle() to set the patterned brush style.
Use DrawPie() and reverse the pair of construction point arguments so that the two pie slices together form a whole ellipse.
